alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hampden; Hampshire; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 2:44PM EDT until August 26 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WESTERN WORCESTER, SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN HAMPDEN AND SOUTHERN HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the initial thunderstorms that moved across the region resulted in widespread 1 to 2 inches of rain. There was a temporary lull in the activity, but additional showers and thunderstorms are expected to move into the region over the next hour or two. This coupled with the earlier heavy rain may result in the potential for flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, Deerfield, South Hadley, Easthampton, Belchertown, Montague, Granby, Southampton, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, Leverett, Russell, Shutesbury and Westhampton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
